text: A look at Dracula's Castle then the camera spinning around a mysterious kid playing violin. Such a simple, yet memorable intro that didn't make you want to press Start. One of my favorite games on the N64.
author: SupraDarky

text: Yeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeessssssssssssssss!
author: Hundey FuFu

text: I take every opportunity to stick up for this game.  Its one excellent Castlevania game.  Sure the camera could be a bear,  but at that time I was freaking glued to my seat! The cut scene of the vampire girl watering flowers with blood,  the lightning strikes at beginning that made me jump,  the angel statue crying blood,  jumping into a casket only to land in a underground cave,  epic boss fights,  and on and on.  So many rememberable moments! People like to bash it now,  but back then it got solid reviews across the board. I have both N64 Castlevania games and they are definitely some differences between them that make it worth while to play both and see all the changes.  Reinhardt in Carrie first outing is best on original release,  while Legacy of Darkness is great for all the new content. Thank you for sharing!
author: Classic Modern Gaming

text: I used to listen to this every single time when I played this game as a kid, loved it!

text: Oh man, this game! I was too scared/bad at games to play through it as a kid, but I read the strategy guide front and back. There was one point in the book where it said "damn" and I had to cover that with a sticker before I could show my friends. Out of everything in that game, I remember the skeletons on motorcycles (right??) and this song the most.

text: I know this game was divisive in its time, between "love it" and "hate it" crowds. I was one of the "love it" people, as the things it did right, to me, overshadowed the issues it had.
